byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

abstract: NATO offers membership to tiny nation of Montenegro, first such expansion in six years, prompting angry reaction from Russia and inflaming tensions at time when West is courting Russia's support in fight against Islamic State; growing strains over events in Ukraine and Russian presence in NATO airspace serve as reminder of gulf between Russia and West and cast doubt on unified front against extremists.
lead_paragraph: The alliance’s decision to invite Montenegro to join drew an angry response from Russia and added another layer of complication to efforts to resolve the crisis in Syria.

headline.main: NATO Unveils Plans to Grow, Drawing Fury and Threats From Russia
headline.print_headline: NATO Invitation to Montenegro Prompts Angry Russian Reaction

snippet: The alliance’s decision to invite Montenegro to join drew an angry response from Russia and added another layer of complication to efforts to resolve the crisis in Syria.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
